pros: Pays well, compensates employees well, and everyone is companionate and kind.
cons: Often have to deal with some heavy matters with members, but that is just the nature of the business, not specific to Codac.

review_title: Good place for when starting carrer
pros: Co-workers are usually pretty awesome people to work with. Management is typically good. Flexible once been there some time . Really understanding if have an personal life concerns and will work with you in effective ways to meet employment goals while tackling person needs .
cons: HR doesn't provide fair pay or have an idea who does what and peoples productivity. Pay is based some what on degree and never off how hard you work. Heavy case loads, lots of work, and have to pick up slack from others who don't do their job. Yearly raises are 3% so inflation will soon bring your pay down.

pros: Meaningful work helping people to get free from opiates
cons: Multiple barriers to care. A nursing culture where a group of the LPNs feels like it's ok to be bullies/demeaning.

pros: rewarding helping people trying to better their lives
cons: overworked, doing job of four three people, understaffed, constant employee turnover

job_title: Certified Clinical Medical Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Learn lots of new skills based on BH care
cons: Compensation for this type of cognitively/mentally demanding work is below where it should be

pros: Good PTO accrual, and benefits
cons: Difficult to deal with mental health

pros: Great team work and co workers
cons: They do not give great hours

pros: Salary decent; facilities nice and well-kept. Good benefits.
cons: If you're not part of the In-group in management, you have no power to accomplish your goals. Often leadership says one thing and does the opposite.

pros: clients are interesting and can walk in and receive services without much wait time. New buildings are nice. Good learning experiences. Doctors approachable and available. They have a 403B and decent vacation time. Most people work hard and have good intentions. No micromanaging...
cons: not much management at all. HR unavailable. Poor supervision. Supervisors unavailable and unresponsive. Case managers have ridiculously large caseloads. I had almost no training (beyond the basic required HR training) and was placed in situations where I was expected to work outside my scope of practice --seemed unethical to me.

review_title: Great employees, but the upper management is destroying employee morale.
pros: The employees are great, and work hard and frequently step out of their role to assist as a team player.  Employees are definitely in it for the "greater good" and not for the money!
cons: Doesn't pay well and has excessively high, unrealistic expectations of employees. Also, upper management frequently only makes appearances when necessary, and has no problem with stepping on toes or throwing their "underlings" under the bus to make themselves look good.

pros: You will have weekends off, good PTO (about one day of vacation and one day of sick a paycheck), and awesome coworkers.
cons:
You have very high case loads (400+ members) which lead to unrealistic expectations a lot of stress. Also, once you get to know the members on your case load, your case load will change and you get a new lot of members. 

My biggest complaint is the management. Some of them are VERY unprofessional. They gossip about colleagues with doors wide open and curse workers out. They are also very quick to throw you under the bus if its beneficial to them.

pros: They will occasionally provide you with breakfast or lunch. Depending on the position the pay is good.
cons: Since this company has had significant budget cuts they take it out on their employees. They leave each employee remaining with the work of three people. They no longer show much staff support. They also tend to give their clients the runaround when it comes to anything simple related to their treatment.

pros:
I worked on the Prevention side of the company. So i had an opportunity to do community mobilization, grant writing, supervising, marketing and collaboration with the mental health division of the company.
We had a very flexible schedule, upward mobility opportunities, great team to work with and supportive senior management team.
cons: evening hours, sometimes weekends, pay was average could have been more competitive.

pros: Great co-workers, team approach, great benefits, great vacation time off, opportunity for advancement
cons: Very high stress, constant change in policies, low pay compared to other agencies

pros: I work with some of the most qualified and diverse individuals in the area.
cons: The field since Cenpatico took over has made it difficult.  A lot of folks have found other places to work.

pros: The human element of making a difference can be very rewarding despite the challenges the work brings.
cons: The need to practice self care and de stress yourself when leaving work. High case loads with expectation of making metrics.

pros: CODAC has really great wrap around services for their patients and you really work as a team for their benefit. They offer generous vacation/sick time after 6 months and help pay for licensing requirements. I really enjoyed working there, learned a lot.
cons: Very early morning hours; sometimes overworked/understaffed.

pros: I enjoy working with peers that have personal experience with mental illness, substance use, or trauma. I enjoy being part of a team.
cons: The pressure of billing and completing notes with the expectation of also being available for crisis and being mobile and flexible is very depletin l

job_title: Recovery Coach High Needs in Tucson, AZ
pros: Generous PTO, Company Vehicle, Short distance from home
cons: Punitive work environment. Low moral. Large caseloads. Sexual harassment. Lots of women in supervisory positions that abuse their authority and protect each other when confronted or challenged. Some supervisors (female) talk to you in a demeaning way in front of others and during meetings.  Unrealistic expectations and workload demands. Low pay and compensation.

review_title: Kind people doing a hard job at CODAC
job_title: Coordinator of Community and Public Relations in Tucson, AZ
pros: Giving people, great benefits, supportive management.
cons: The nature of the job is tough because it's working with a very high risk population that desperately needs help.

pros:
CEO is approachable
Some management staff care about members
Pay is decent
cons:
Company takes on programs they have little to no knowledge how to run effectively.
Will penalize you for not meeting extremely high objectives.
Cares more about money than members

pros: I had some great colleagues.
cons: Unmanageable workload and inability to put forth quality care/work because of this. No transparency between upper management and staff. Constant changes. Low pay, low morale. Very superficial.

job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Providence, RI
pros: I love working as a counselor and helping people. I am currently retired but would like to work part time.
cons: Very early hours 6am. to 2:30pm.

job_title: Customer Service Manager in Tucson, AZ
pros: Highly recognized in the community
cons: Can be a fear driven, punitive environment to work in.

pros: Great opportunity to learn about the field, growth in the company, learning anout your own community
cons: Getting someone in Human Resources to return your call in a reasonable amount of time.

pros: The benefits and time off are amazing.
cons: Caseload is over 350, expectations are unrealistic, high turn over rate.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Tucson, AZ
pros: Good benefits, PTO and mileage reimbursement.  The TPD pleasant and helpful.
cons: Unprofessional and unorganized with useless training by current employees.  DEA compliance not up to date. Current employees complain about rate of pay and negative interactions with supervisors.

pros: Working with great people and seeing the member make amazing progress
cons: Management and the stress of meeting your metrics. Unrealistic expectations of a Case Manager.
